node.doctext:
The answer to 99% of the questions you'll be asked over the course of your [brief lives] is simple, honest and almost always correct: "It depends."

In any given situation there is an infinite number of variables. For every variable you're aware of there are an infinite number you are not aware of.

E2 is not a competition. Do votes/reps/xp even have value? Yes, as a general guideline I find they are accurate. There is no 'fair'.

But that other guy's writeup is dumber than mine!!

I know, I know...you already knew that. People have been telling you the world isn't fair since you were born, right? All of them were telling you the truth. There's no fair, there's no Santa Claus and your mommy don't love you. There it is. There's no justice, either. To answer an editorial or user opinion on your work with "But so-and-so a node is way dumber/stupider/poorly spelled/poorly titled/etc example why not pick on that guy?" is simply unacceptable. We'll (hopefully) get to that guy, to that other writeup that needs work...but for right now we're working you and yours. There is simply a good chance that E2's current standards are higher than they've ever been...older, poorer writeups do not excuse newer, poorer work. Nope. Nope. Nope.

There are inane, babbling and mean one-liner writeups that are spelled incorrectly, filed under ridiculous titles, placed on the [Page of Cool] and voted up to [rep|reps] of over 100. Yet yours was voted down to -8 and [voting/experience system|killed with penalty]. That sucks. It sucks and it happens every day. The reasons are many. Any given user submits any given writeup which is viewed/voted upon by any given number of other users with any given number of personalities, issues, ideals, beliefs, practices, philosophies, hang-ups and bedroom habits. Then simply calculate the editor effect...you've only got a few dozen more personalities, practices and moods to take into account there. (Keep in mind [the power structure of everything 2|the editorial staff] is also human...they are neither [golem] or [homonculi]. Objectivity, while a heady goal, is ultimately unattainable.) It's that complex. It's that simple.

The only advice I can give you is to not take it personally. Then again, it's quite possibly somebody who has simply decided they don't like you.

Nevermind.

It depends.
node.title: Why did my writeup get voted down??
